definition: a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: An application is unresponsive or hangs indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 应用程序无响应或无限期悬挂。

sentences.english: In July, a federal judge indefinitely enjoined publication of the book.
sentences.chinese: 7月，一名联邦法官无限期地禁止了此书的出版。

sentences.english: The Government has indefinitely deferred the Tamar development project.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定无限期押后添马舰的发展工程。

sentences.english: Rising prosperity alone will not placate people indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅是繁荣昌盛不足以无限期地安抚民众。

sentences.english: Junior and middle-ranking civil servants have pledged to join the indefinite strike.
sentences.chinese: 基层和中层公务员已承诺要加入到无限期罢工中来。

sentences.english: She knew well that a woman's vis. t is. apt to spin itself out for an indeterminate time.
sentences.chinese: 她很清楚，一个女人作客很容易无限期地延续下去。

sentences.english: We regret to inform you that you are being furloughed indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 我们遗憾地通知您，您将要无限期地在家待岗。

sentences.english: The opportunity will not remain open indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 这个机会不会无限期地敞开。

sentences.english: He warns the delay cannot go on indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 他警告说，北韩不能无限期地拖延下去。

sentences.english: McKinsey has put Mr. Kumar on an indefinite leave of absence.
sentences.chinese: 麦肯锡已经要求库马尔无限期休假。

sentences.english: With most CFDs you can hold the position for as long as you like.
sentences.chinese: 大多数差价合约可以让阁下无限期持仓。

sentences.english: He or she is still in an infinitely long vacation mado to avoid battles.
sentences.chinese: 他或她仍处于一种无限期休假模式以避免战争。

sentences.english: This situation seemed to go on indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 这种状况似乎要无限期地继续下去。

sentences.english: She can cite a docket of cases of endless separation.
sentences.chinese: 她能说出许多无限期分居案例的案卷摘要。

sentences.english: The Bernese and other Swiss voted for some indefinite penalty.
sentences.chinese: 在伯尔尼瑞士和其他一些投票无限期刑罚。

sentences.english: Hain said Britain joined the euro zone can not be postponed indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 海因称，英国加入欧元区不能被无限期推迟。

definition: far in the indefinite future (idiom); so far away it seems forever
to set a time limit/time limit/deadline
several weeks/also written 數週|数周
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
to push back (progress, the times etc)
to stop work/to shut down/to stop production
to cease/to suspend/to break off/to stop/to discontinue
to terminate an agreement/to cancel a contract
